title: How many people are waiting for treatment?
analysis_commentary: In the context of other measures surrounding waiting times it is also important to look at the number of people who are joining the list and waiting for treatment each month. In mid 2007 the waiting list was large, with over 4 million people waiting for treatment. This was reduced drastically to under 2.5 million by winter 2009. We see a clear seasonal trend with the list being longer over the summer months and shorter in the winter. Despite these seasonal changes we see an overall upwards trend in the waiting list. Since April 2014 there have been more than 3 million people waiting for treatment in every month.
data_source: NHS England, Referral to Treatment waiting times
